“What should I say to them?” he asked bitterly. “That I murdered her but hid the money?” 

Sonia’s eyes widened. “It will be too much for you to bear!” 

“Perhaps I’ve been unfair to myself,” he pondered, a haughty smile forming. “I’ll make another fight for it.” 

“What a burden to bear!” she exclaimed. 

“I’ll get used to it,” he replied grimly. “The police are after me.” 

“Ach!” Sonia cried, terrified. 

“Why are you frightened? I won’t give myself up. They have no real evidence.” 

He paused, confidence returning. “I can turn their accusations to my credit.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The protagonist grapples with guilt and the fear of arrest while contemplating his actions and their consequences.
